Overview text: This online program will be offered to practicing medical professionals who wish to obtain further expertise in medical ultrasound for clinical practice.

The course is designed to provide the knowledge-base necessary for diagnostic-level performance of echocardiography and interpretation; surface ultrasound uses such as ultrasound guided procedures and nerve blocks; and other medical specialist specific ultrasound applications such as vascular ultrasound examination. The aim is to provide advanced knowledge to specialist craft groups to facilitate use of ultrasound relevant to their specialty.

The Graduate Diploma in Clinical Ultrasound is part of a nested program of courses related to the use of clinical ultrasound. The program includes the Graduate Certificate in Clinical Ultrasound and the Master of Clinical Ultrasound.

Entry requirements: 1. In order to be considered for entry, applicants must have completed:
a Doctor of Medicine or a Bachelor of Medicine/Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS) or equivalent, or
an undergraduate degree or equivalent in allied health, nursing, physiotherapy, or science.
Meeting this requirement does not guarantee selection.

overview: To satisfy the requirements of the Graduate Diploma of Clinical Ultrasound students must successfully complete a total of 100 points, comprising of five compulsory subjects (62.5 points; 12.5 each subject) and three elective subjects (37.5 points).

Further Study: Students can articulate to the Master of Clinical Ultrasound
